alert.note: Alert for Cheatham (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 12 at 1:08PM CDT until April 12 at 3:06PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Tennessee... Sycamore Creek Near Ashland City affecting Cheatham County. .The rainfall has ended for the time, and the creek will crest and fall sharply. For the Sycamore Creek...including Ashland City...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Sycamore Creek Near Ashland City. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Low lying and agricultural areas along Sycamore Creek are inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 11.0 feet and rising. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 315 PM CDT.
